div.p: Group 2 Mapping from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Task|5.0.0 to Extensions for Using Data Elements from FHIR R5 in FHIR R4

tr.td: Element `Task.statusReason` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Task.statusReason` as `SourceIsBroaderThanTarget`, concept domain: `NotRelatedTo`, value domain: `NotRelatedTo`.
Element `Task.requestedPeriod` has a context of Task based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Task`.
Element `Task.requestedPerformer` has a context of Task based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Task`.
Element `Task.performer` has a context of Task based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Task`.

Note that the target element context `Task.input.value[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Task.input`. Element `Task.input.value[x]` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Task.input.value[x]` as `RelatedTo`, concept domain: `NotRelatedTo`, value domain: `NotRelatedTo`. Note that the target element context `Task.input.value[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Task.input`.

Note that the target element context `Task.output.value[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Task.output`. Element `Task.output.value[x]` is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Task.output.value[x]` as `RelatedTo`, concept domain: `NotRelatedTo`, value domain: `NotRelatedTo`. Note that the target element context `Task.output.value[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Task.output`.

div.p: Group 3 Mapping from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Task|5.0.0 to FHIR Extensions Packversion: 5.2.0)

tr.td: Note that there is an externally-defined extension that has been flagged as the representation of FHIR R5 element `Task.doNotPerform`: `http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/request-doNotPerform`. Element `Task.doNotPerform` has a context of Task based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Task`.

Note that there is an externally-defined extension that has been flagged as the representation of FHIR R5 element `Task.performer.actor` with an unmapped Reference type: `http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/alternate-reference`. Element `Task.performer.actor` has a context of Task based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Task`.

div.p: Group 4 Mapping from http://hl7.org/fhir/StructureDefinition/Task|5.0.0 to unspecified code system

tr.td: Element `Task.performer.function` has a context of Task based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `Task`.
